title: Protest Leaders in Ecuador Agree to Talks With the Government
text:
QUITO, Ecuador—An umbrella organization for the indigenous groups that have been at the forefront of turbulent protests against President Lenín Moreno said Saturday that it agreed to direct talks with the government over the contentious removal of fuel subsides that had sparked the demonstrations.

The Conaie, which represents various indigenous communities in this Andean country, was responding to Mr. Moreno’s televised speech on Friday, in which he called on “leaders to talk directly with me.” The talks are to begin Sunday...
description: An umbrella organization for the indigenous groups that have been at the forefront of turbulent protests against President Lenín Moreno said Saturday that it agreed to direct talks with the government.
